DataElement.preferredName: Stereotactic Body Radiation Therapy Planning Technique Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text abbreviation that represents the radiation therapy planning technique.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Stereotactic Body Radiation Therapy Radiation Therapy Treatment Planning and Simulation Technique
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Stereotactic radiation therapy in which one or several maximum dose radiation treatments are delivered targeting cancers of the body, excluding the brain or spine._The creation of a strategy, and the rehearsal of that strategy, for the purpose of identifying and eliminating any problems that may present during treatment._A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Stereotactic radiation therapy in which one or several maximum dose radiation treatments are delivered targeting cancers of the body, excluding the brain or spine.

Concepts.definition: Stereotactic radiation therapy in which one or several maximum dose radiation treatments are delivered targeting cancers of the body, excluding the brain or spine.

Property.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Treatment Planning and Simulation Technique
Property.preferredDefinition: The creation of a strategy, and the rehearsal of that strategy, for the purpose of identifying and eliminating any problems that may present during treatment.:A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

Concepts.longName: Radiation Therapy Treatment Planning and Simulation
Concepts.definition: The creation of a strategy, and the rehearsal of that strategy, for the purpose of identifying and eliminating any problems that may present during treatment.
A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, Toronto, ON

ValueDomain.preferredName: Stereotactic Body Radiation Therapy Technique Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Stereotactic radiation therapy in which one or several maximum dose radiation treatments are delivered targeting cancers of the body, excluding the brain or spine._A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy (3D CRT) that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3D CRT.

Concepts.definition: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy (3D CRT) that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3D CRT.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Radiation therapy delivered to the whole volume of target tissue by a single rotation of the linear accelerator gantry.

Concepts.definition: Radiation therapy delivered to the whole volume of target tissue by a single rotation of the linear accelerator gantry.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An evacuated glass tube designed to accelerate electrons onto a screen to create images.

Concepts.definition: An evacuated glass tube designed to accelerate electrons onto a screen to create images.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A twofold increase.: Radiation therapy delivered to the whole volume of target tissue by a single rotation of the linear accelerator gantry.

Concepts.definition: Radiation therapy delivered to the whole volume of target tissue by a single rotation of the linear accelerator gantry.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
